Articles.Content:
[@FreeThinker](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/117389-freethinker/)

Loading IFS Core on a vanilla 1.12.5 game is resulting in an immediate CTD, it's a result of the MiniAVC.dll.

Might be helpful if you removed that

> > > On 1/21/2023 at 7:11 PM, linuxgurugamer said: > > > [@FreeThinker](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/117389-freethinker/) > > > > > Loading IFS Core on a vanilla 1.12.5 game is resulting in an immediate CTD, it's a result of the MiniAVC.dll. > > > > > Might be helpful if you removed that > thanks, I updated the package: ## Version 3.30.0 for Kerbal Space Program 1.12.5 which can be downloaded from here Released on 2023-01-22 - Compiled against KSP 1.15.5 - removed MiniAVC.dll which was causing CTD

[@FreeThinker](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/117389-freethinker/)  

Is there any way to prevent interstellar fuel switch from interacting with the Procedural Parts mod?  

It's completely messing up tank volumes for me

**Edited <time datetime="2023-01-28T13:51:09Z" title="01/28/2023 01:51  PM" data-short="1 yr">January 28, 2023</time> by RB101**

> 
> 
> On 1/28/2023 at 2:41 PM, RB101 said:
> 
> 
> [@FreeThinker](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/117389-freethinker/)  
> 
>   
> 
> Is there any way to prevent interstellar fuel switch from interacting with the Procedural Parts mod?  
> 
>   
> 
> It's completely messing up tank volumes for me
> 

yes,

remove the patch files LFOpatch.cfg, LFpatch.cfg, Oxygenpatch.cfg and Xenonpatch.cfg

Hi [@FreeThinker](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/117389-freethinker/)  

I have a problem with Cryoengine, when I change the configuration of a fuel tank to MethaLOX for example, the tank become LqdMethane and LqdOxygen instead of Oxidizer, I checked and I don't have any other mod that uses LqdOxygen, do you have any idea where to look to troubleshoot the problem ?  

Thanks

EDIT : SOLVED, I'm dumb, it was a sneaky patch by a part of rational ressource mod, my bad.

Hi ! 

I'm not sure which mod is the culprit in my case, so I'm posting in both B9PS and here, sory in advance : )

I'm having a serious warning each time I pull a stock tank in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr></abbr>, like B9 and IFS are patching the same part, but not "cleanly" so that this message shoudn't pop up...  

bellow screenshot, and dropbox links with ksp.log, and <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)"><abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr></abbr> log,

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/yptzlw66q2u7u12/Player.log?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/yptzlw66q2u7u12/Player.log?dl=0)

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/lterynr0ott3nm6/ModuleManager.log?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/lterynr0ott3nm6/ModuleManager.log?dl=0)

Thanks for your help ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")  

![fT6v3Dx.png](https://i.imgur.com/fT6v3Dx.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2023-05-07T09:47:54Z" title="05/07/2023 09:47  AM" data-short="1 yr">May 7, 2023</time> by kurgut**

Hi !

What patch should I need to edit in order to make all fuel types switch available at start in career ?  

Currently, the basic squad 1.25m fuel tanks don't accept all option (such as LH2/Oxi), whereas they do in sandbox.

I'm quite early game, but have some cryo engines unlocked already, using CTT.

thanks ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

I wanted to add to your comment that I encountered this problem when installing this mod. I had some ships with cryogenic engines and when I installed this mod I can no longer use them. Do you know any mod that adds all needed fuels into single tank with correct ratio? 

**Edited <time datetime="2023-05-23T08:44:46Z" title="05/23/2023 08:44  AM" data-short="1 yr">May 23, 2023</time> by NaviG**

[@FreeThinker](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/profile/117389-freethinker/) I'm having some problems with the lithium air battery. Basicly, it doesn't fully recharge, always stopping about 0.5KWh from full. It's not an issue with larger batteries, but when scaling the battery right down for ion engine probes it's causing problems. At 0.2m scale (smallest) the battery has a capacity of 0.4KWh, so once discharged it can't be recharged at all.
How do I define tank mass for massless resources, like Electric Charge?

Is there any config file I can edit or anything else I can do to add Methalox + Oxidizer to stock fuel tanks, I've managed to add 'MethaOxi' to different tank types in IFS but I haven't been able to find the one for stock tanks.

> 
> 
> On 10/13/2016 at 12:50 AM, FreeThinker said:
> 
> 
> ## 
> Version 2.2.3 <small>for Kerbal Space Program 1.2</small>
> 
> 
> 
> 
> <small>Released on 2016-10-13</small>
> 
> 
> 
> - Compiled against KSP 1.2
> - When displayCurrentTankCost is true shows Dry Tank Cost, Resource Cost and Total Cost
> - Fixed Bug of Cost giving negative numbers
> - Added Oxygen-18, Nitrogen-15 and Fluorine to Cryogenic container
> - Fixed an issue where Mass ratio was not properly updated in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr></abbr> the first time after switching
> - Fixed resource volume and mass ratio of new Cryogenic container
> - Includes Module Manager compatible with KSP 1.2
> 

I'm curious..what's the purpose of Oxygen-18? Is there any in-game use? This is the only place where Oxygen-18 is mentioned in KSP context..

> 
> 
> On 11/18/2023 at 2:54 AM, tierso said:
> 
> 
> I'm curious..what's the purpose of Oxygen-18? Is there any in-game use? This is the only place where Oxygen-18 is mentioned in KSP context..
> 

Oxygen 18 can be used as a advanced alternative Fusion Fuel source in Interstellar Extended, basicly it allows you to Run on an oxygen source, which is effectly almost anywhere. Its uselfull as a get home space fuel source.

**Edited <time datetime="2023-11-20T13:59:08Z" title="11/20/2023 01:59  PM" data-short="Nov 20">November 20, 2023</time> by FreeThinker**
